title: Linkage Attack on Skeleton-based Motion Visualization
subtitle: CIKM 2023 - Conference Paper
organization: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
description: This research introduces a novel linkage attack on skeleton-based motion visualization in VR, demonstrating how supposedly anonymous skeleton data can reveal personally identifiable information (PII). The model, Linkage Attack Neural Network (LAN), utilizes a Siamese network to match skeletons and expose linkages. This work highlights privacy risks in VR and proposes anonymization methods through motion retargeting to mitigate these risks.

title: Privacy-Centric Deep Motion Retargeting for Anonymization of Skeleton-Based Data
subtitle: AAAI 2025 - Conference Paper
organization: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
description: This study presents a Privacy-Centric Deep Motion Retargeting (PMR) model that anonymizes skeleton-based data by transferring user motion onto a dummy skeleton. Using adversarial learning, the model effectively mitigates PII in VR settings, protecting user identity while maintaining action recognition accuracy. PMR performs on par with state-of-the-art retargeting models and advances the development of privacy-preserving technologies in virtual environments.

title: Skeleton Motion Retargeting Through Masked Language Model Transformers
subtitle: SIGKDD 2025 - Conference Paper
organization: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
description: This paper explores the use of masked language model transformers for motion retargeting in skeleton-based data, addressing privacy concerns in VR. The proposed model leverages transformer architectures to anonymize motion while preserving action recognition accuracy, enabling safe skeleton data usage in virtual and augmented reality applications.

title: Skeleton Privacy Preservation via Intelligent Noise and Masking Using Explanation
subtitle: PAKDD 2025 - Conference Paper
organization: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
description: This research investigates methods of skeleton privacy preservation using intelligent noise injection and masking, supported by explainable AI techniques. Aimed at safeguarding PII in VR environments, this work provides a framework for anonymizing skeleton data without compromising data utility, contributing to privacy-first designs in machine learning and computer vision.

title: ViBot
subtitle: Discord Bot
description: ViBot is a comprehensive Discord bot for managing community organization and moderation in 'Realm of the Mad God'. Features include user authentication, moderation, and a REST API for external web app interaction. ViBot also includes a basic machine learning model for user account detection (alternate vs. main) and utilizes NLP and web scraping for dynamic data gathering. The project emphasizes skills in real-time analytics, cloud deployment, and backend integration with Google Cloud and AWS.

title: ViBot.tech
subtitle: Web App
description: A web-based interface for interacting with the ViBot project, showcasing data visualization and real-time server management. This web app integrates with Discord's OAuth2 for authentication and is hosted on Google Firebase. Built with a focus on responsive design, secure SSL implementation, and efficient API integration, ViBot.tech demonstrates strong skills in full-stack development and user authentication for web applications.

title: Recycling Classification
subtitle: Webapp + Machine Learning Model
organization: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
description: A computer vision application for recycling classification based on image/video input, built using PyTorch and FastAI. The project utilizes image processing and data augmentation techniques to improve classification accuracy. Hosted on Google Firebase with a frontend in React.js, it integrates deep learning and web app deployment, demonstrating proficiency in applied AI, sustainability tech, and image recognition solutions.

title: Blue Bounty
subtitle: Note Taking Webapp
organization: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
description: Blue Bounty is a collaborative note-taking app designed in React.js and Node.js for group projects. Initially intended to be an HTML/CSS app, we expanded it to include an Express.js backend after gaining approval. The project highlights skills in team collaboration, Agile development, and full-stack web app deployment. It emphasizes efficient backend communication and user-friendly design.

title: Thomasc.tech
subtitle: Personal Portfolio Website
description: A personal portfolio website to showcase academic, professional, and personal projects. Built with React.js and designed with a focus on UI/UX and responsive design principles. Thomasc.tech demonstrates strengths in frontend development, web design, and creating user-centered experiences. Itâ€™s a platform for both self-promotion and learning advanced React techniques.

title: Charlotte Research Connect
subtitle: UNC Charlotte Research Webapp
organization: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
description: Charlotte Research Connect is a web application that visualizes and organizes research data for UNC Charlotte's faculty. Developed using React.js, MySQL, and Express, it provides an accessible interface for exploring research projects. Emphasis on data visualization, REST API integration, and full-stack development, showcasing skills in database management and academic data presentation.

title: C-Track
subtitle: Asset Tracking Webapp
description: C-Track is a real-time asset tracking system designed for internal use at MDCentric. Built with React.js and Express, it uses MS SQL Server for data storage and Microsoft OAuth for authentication. Features include user permissions management, customizable attributes, and enterprise-level data security. This project highlights skills in enterprise application development, real-time data handling, and secure authentication solutions.
